content.description: The Anand Milk Union Limited (AMUL) is India's largest food product organization and a cooperative dairy movement that revolutionized the dairy industry in India. It is a symbol of India's white revolution and a significant economic driver for the region.

The Sardar Patel Memorial in Anand, Gujarat, honors the Iron Man of India, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel. Located in the town of Anand, it features an impressive collection of photographs, documents, and statues. The peaceful surroundings make it a perfect place for reflection on Patel's leadership and vision.
A prominent Swaminarayan temple known for its intricate architecture and spiritual significance. It serves as a center for religious and cultural activities in Vidyanagar, Anand District.
A unique museum located in Anand dedicated to the art of floral arrangements and decorations. It showcases various creative uses of flowers and plants.
A temple dedicated to Saint Jalaram Bapa, revered for his compassion and service to the needy, located in Anand. It serves as a place of worship and community gathering.

content.place: Local Handicraft Fairs in Anand District
content.description: Various local fairs and markets across Anand District showcase traditional Gujarati handicrafts, including pottery, embroidery, and woodwork. These events provide a platform for artisans and preserve local crafts.
A revered Hanuman temple located in Anand known for its spiritual significance and the large number of devotees it attracts.
A significant Hanuman temple in Lambhvel village near Anand, known for its Swayambhu (self-manifested) idol. A large fair is held annually, attracting thousands of devotees.
A temple dedicated to Ashapuri Mataji located in Piplav, Anand District. It is a significant religious site for the local community.

description: Ahmedabad is a city in western India.The Sabarmati River runs through its center. Ahmedabad is famous for its textile industry and is known as the...

content.description: Established by Mahatma Gandhi in 1915, this ashram marks the beginning of his Satyagraha movement. It houses a museum with personal artifacts, photographs, and writings of Gandhi.
The largest lake in Ahmedabad, featuring a zoo, toy train, kids' city, tethered balloon ride, and more.
A museum and exhibition center dedicated to India's first Deputy Prime Minister, housed in the Moti Shahi Mahal.
A public park known for its handicraft market and street food stalls.
A city square that transforms from a vegetable market in the morning to a jewelry market in the afternoon and a foodie's paradise at night.
A rejuvenated riverfront area hosting events like marathons, flower shows, and cultural festivals.
Built in 1848 by Sheth Hutheesing, this temple is dedicated to Lord Dharmanatha and features intricate carvings and a marble courtyard.
Located in Kumbhariya, these temples were constructed between 1062 and 1231 CE during the reign of the Chaulukya dynasty and are noted for their elaborate architecture.
Founded over 250 years ago, this temple is dedicated to Lord Hanuman and is renowned for its religious significance and association with soldiers.
A spiritual complex dedicated to Smt. Shilaben Indravadan Modi, featuring a Nagara-style temple with deities from Shaiv, Shakti, and Vaishnav traditions.
A cultural hub promoting traditional and contemporary art forms through exhibitions, workshops, and performances.
A guided tour through the walled city, showcasing architectural marvels, stepwells, and the rich history of Ahmedabad.
Known as the Shaking Minarets, this 15th-century mosque features two minarets that vibrate simultaneously when one is shaken.
Displays a vast collection of vintage and classic cars, showcasing automotive history and design.​
A 15th-century stepwell in Ahmedabad, showcasing intricate Indo-Islamic architecture and stone carvings, built for water conservation
A modern pedestrian bridge over the Sabarmati River in Ahmedabad, known for its eye-catching design and vibrant LED lighting.
An interactive science center featuring exhibits on space, robotics, and environmental science, catering to all age groups.​
An ancient Indus Valley Civilization site, Lothal was a major center for trade and bead-making, with a well-planned dockyard.
A golf resort with an 18-hole signature golf course, luxury accommodations, event spaces, and a blend of colonial architecture.
A premium sports and leisure club featuring facilities for football, basketball, cricket, swimming, and more. It also offers banquet halls, suites, and wellness services.
A Gary Player-designed 9-hole championship golf course set in a serene environment, offering luxury resort amenities and a pro shop.
Situated in Ahmedabad, Kite Museum is a prime tourist attraction of Gujarat. The museum is a part of Sanskar Kendra, which was formed in 1954 as the cultural centre of Ahmedabad.
